title: [Quality improvement in Danish healthcare services - status and recommendations].

abstract: In light of a 2018 report by WHO, OECD and World Bank, we provide a set of recommendations for quality improvement in Danish healthcare services, in this review: 1) Easily accessible decision-relevant local quality data should be provided. 2) The legal basis for quality development and research should be clarified. 3) The effort to develop patient-reported outcome measures should be intensified. 4) All clinicians should be involved in quality improvement, and quality improvement methods should be included in all healthcare professionals' training curricula.
